attributes.action: Stop the tolls on the Merseytunnels.
attributes.additional_details: The Isle of Skye Bridge opened in 1995 and has already made a £10m profit and the Scottish government bought the bridge from the private consortium for £27m. Hope your not giving up just because Ester McVey lost her seat in the Wirral.
attributes.background: The Railway tunnel opened in 1887 Queensway in 1934 and Kingsway in 1971. End the £10.5m subsidies to other transport schemes and use it to pay off the £45m debts by 2020 instead if 2045. We all know the Conservatives dislike subsidies as that why your trying to end tax credits.

rejection.details:
The tolls on the Mersey Tunnels are the responsibility of the Liverpool City Region Combined Authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
